roleset.name: to force, drive, a driving force

example.name: all arguments
example.text: He recently voted `` present '' when the committee authorized a subpoena [*0*]-1 [*T*-2] to compel Mr. Keating to testify [*T*-1] , then changed his vote to yes .

example.name: passive
example.text: That is , he is being compelled to put them on the market too soon , and has already gotten offers that are less than he paid for some of the art works .

propbank.arg: to put them on the market too soon

example.name: passive with adverbials
example.text: Thus , in a criminal case , a prosecutor can not comment on a defendant 's failure to testify nor can the defendant be compelled to take the stand as a witness , thus forcing him to `` take the Fifth . ''

propbank.arg: to take the stand as a witness
thus forcing him to `` take the Fifth

example.name: Args 0 and 2
example.text: My patient realized this and was able to overcome her compulsion to go to the mirror by paradoxically wishing , ? Let my hair stand on end . Let it be a mess ! "

example.name: all args
example.text: Damon?s desire for Elena was obvious to everyone but Elena for a long time , and he?d do anything in order to keep her safe ( and happy , hence his own thoughtful and beautiful confession of love and then his compulsion of her to forget ) .

roleset.note: COMPEL-V NOTES: Based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Member of VNcls force-59. Comparison with 'force'. (from compel.01-v)
COMPULSION-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01. Comparison to compel.01, which maps to VN class force-59. No FN entry. (from compulsion.01-n)
